column5: Any ideas on how to steer the kicker motor with the larger motor, I have a 9.9 and 115 mercury on the back of my 18' starcraft futura boat. It would be nice to have them linked together.  Bing
kicker attachment  another from the same site

I ordered the Panther one by Marine Tech from Cabelas.  Actually it just arrived about an hour ago on the courier.  It seems like decent quality and was only $28.99 for the zinc plated model, stainless is about double.
I have the E.Z Steer system with my new boat.  The boat isn't in the water yet so I can't say how well it works.  But judging from the price of the system and reviews, its pretty decent.
Nothing against what you bought,but if you want quality and longevity,S/S is the choice. IMO Like you said "plated",one scratch and the rust starts.

Your probably right.  The only reason I went with the plated one was because for my set up  I will need to bend the rod and in the reviews some one had suggested the stainless was difficult to bend into the shape you need.  If it wasn't for that fact I definitley would go stainless.  No doubt the first scratch will occur while bending.  Besides that though in general the bar and all the connectors seem pretty solid.
